concept.title: .NET SDK 2.2
concept.shortdesc: The .NET Couchbase SDK provides a way to store and retrieve your objects to and from a Couchbase cluster. It can be used via a synchronous or asynchronous interface.

conbody.p: Here's a sampling of what you can do with the Couchbase .NET SDK:

section.title: Storing Documents
section.p: You can store items by using the Upsert<T> method. This method serializes your data structure and stores it on the cluster. To store a document, just create a new Document object, and fill in the fields you need:
You can store anything serializable in the Content field, not just strings.

After the document has been created, you can store it in the cluster by using the Upsert method:bucket.Upsert(doc);Upsert is a combination of insert and update and will either replace an existing item if it exists or create it anew if it's not yet present.

section.title: Retrieving Documents
section.p: To retrieve a document, use the bucket's GetDocument method. This contains status information and the contents of the document:
section.codeblock: var result = bucket.GetDocument("document_id"); Console.WriteLine(result.Content); // Prints "Hello World!"
